title: Clash Beta launches in North America

replies.body: Making people be honor level 2 is kinda stupid. Most people who will participate in clash want to play with friends so they normally wont even flame.
It's not to make sure that you don't flame your friends, it's to punish you for being a toxic player with random people.

A lot of toxic people will not hesitate to make the game miserable for their team, team mates, or the enemy team with abusive and berating language. Sorry, if someone's going to flame and be a toxic piece of garbage, they don't deserve any sympathy. Frankly, I'd prefer it if they were given less slack - I wish it was way easier for a flamer to get banned from certain game modes, chat, ranked play, etc. for being a trash bag of a human being.
If only the banning system actually differentiated those people.

I have been banned. It was horrible I was a dumb stupid 14 year old and I was mostly banned for leaving then my final ban and the perma was because of toxicity. And boy did I deserve it, however I had around $700 in the game and it was depressing to lose it all so I took a long break. I came back to it after season 6 was about to end and leveled up a new account. I then got gold my highest rating yet. And I was so excited, I have not bounced back to my old ways other than a really bad week and got a chat ban however I feel I have become a more mature and nicer player in the league community.

Ya know, one of my favorite things in games is to surf the forums and see people talk about how they were banned for doing nothing wrong. They either turn into pure toxic sludge in the comments or occasionally a mod will share some chat logs indicating how toxic the person is. You never see them say 'oh crap man, my bad.'

I take the same approach to this. If the vast majority of the playerbase doesn't have the issue, it seems to indicate that the system is functioning.

tbh im kinda sad im almost honor 1 because i learned from my mistakes but the system is so hard to get out of once you are honor 0. I mean I understood what I did but its so hard to climb up in the honor system.

I mean I got chat restricted in early December for saying a bad word to my friend in game. I am still honor level 1 checkpoint 1. I feel like I should be able to play clash, but the slope getting back from punishment is wayyyy too steep. I've been playing constantly too (lvl 100).

Riot doesn't give a crap. My account has NEVER even had a chat restriction for all of 5 years and I have gotten every icon for being in the top 10% of the most honorable in the game and they wouldn't even listen to my issue on how I got hazed in a flex queue where they banned all my adcs because their last adc fed. I got a 2 week suspension, lost my end of season rewards and honor. All I asked was to know they were punished and they told me "its against their policy" and when I mentioned the Report feedback system they just tell me "It's a rare case" yet me and my friend got 5 back to back in a span of 2 days. They don't give a flying fuck about "Honor" they just throw shiny things in your face to entice you.
I got punished for saying "shit" twice in a completely non-toxic manner. So, guess I'm locked out of the fun for that.

I highly doubt that.  Cursing is completely allowed.  It's only if you use those words to insult someone that you get punished.

If you truly were punished unjustly, take it up with player support, they're generally pretty helpful.
They're very very helpful with everything except any type of penalty involving "toxicity" whether you were toxic or not.

i duo a lot with a friend an he doesn't chat in game but he got banned after a game cause the 3 other teammates didn't like the champ he played an got banned for a week. so sure the system works great

How does that sound fair, " it's to punish you for being a toxic player with random people." the punishment is the 2 week ban or the 40 game chat restriction, players should not be kicked out of community events because they had a 10 game chat restriction 3 months ago. Either way if all people that are under honor level 2 don't get to play that means even more smurfs on top of how many there already will be.
all champs are unlocked. all you need to be is honor level 2 (base level) and be ranked. this punishes nobody.
its punishing me for something that happened 4 months ago in one game

I've been occasionally toxic in games where I get super tilted, and have never had an issue because of overwhelmingly positive/honors in most my play.

This doesn't happen because of a one time thing. You were punished for that one event, but you were reported multiple times before that for toxic behavior.

Requiring level 2 honor provides an incentive for players to behave properly overall in every game, not only with friends. If you have trouble getting honor, then you are the problem. 

Here's tip #1: Don't say anything unless it's positive, especially to random players unless you're asked (99.99% people don't ask). This is taught in college for interpersonal communication!

bet $100 they still won't honor you after the game... happens to me..... a lot. 

#RespectSupports
I can't say I can relate to that... I had honor lvl 5 on 3 accounts last season and am heading there this year again while playing about 4x a week and maining support and jungle for the most part...

This is the stuff I hate seeing. This makes riot think the player base thinks like this. Chat is not for positive comments only. It is used for banter and communication. If you don't like someone then just mute them. Getting honor is actually a problem if you only play 5 mans with friends as honors from them are basically worthless. I play league to have fun and got chat banned for being admittedly toxic, months later and I haven't moved at all because snowflakes like you make riot think that toxicity is the biggest plague in this game. Gamethrowers and AFK's are far more important. I can't stop them from ruining the game, if a toxic person is ruining your game just mute them. Can we please have riot focus on the important stuff? Not banning people and blocking them from new features because they insulted someone.

Exactly this, absolutely no reason for honor level 2.
 People flame random teammates, not friends.
Then don't flame and be the cause of a toxic community. Easy.

Well I think it is different for each case. For me: My account has barely ever had a punishment to it besides 2-3 months ago I had a one bad game and received a 10 game chat restriction. Since then I have been trying to grind to Honor Level 2, it is very difficult, I played over/around 300 games in which I received many honors, got my rewards back, I've gotten a lot of key fragments since then but still Honor Level 1. The grind is just very difficult and now I am locked out of a tournament I have been anticipating for months because of 1 10 game chat restriction... Also I feel like if your playing with a pre-made than why the Honor Level 2 requirement? I understand with a group of randoms but pre-made sounds kind've iffy.
You don't get a chat restriction from one game of flame unless you said some really bad stuff

I don't really know how you honor level 1 players don't understand. There's one easy way to not let that happen: don't get involved. That's it. There is a stark difference between a toxic flaming attitude and excited banter.

i will get angry at you 100% of the time if youre fooling around in my ranked game

no offense to you Hines57, but youre bronze 3. i have played years to get to the level i am and im trying my damnedest to hit diamond. you might not be able to tell, but at platinum you can EASILY tell when someone is fucking around. bad games aside (which you can also distinguish at my level) if you fuck around and try to lose you deserve all of the rage. not only do you waste at LEAST 30 min of my time (match finding, champ select, 20 min surrender cause they dont do it at 15) but you also strip away my points.

People who are new to the game( 2 years at least) dont understand how much time some of us have put into this game. And to have some child who barely plays and says oh i dont care or this is my second account it really pisses me off.

I find it hilarious that the biggest complaint is being honor level 2...

Well, we don't want you toxic players in the league making it crappy for everyone else...

Really,  if you aren't Honor Level 2 you REALLY need some self control.
You can get demoted to below honor level 2 for afk. happens quite frequently don't be so toxic to people just because they don't have a solid honor level only makes the whole situation worst tbh

If you're AFKing enough to get demoted below honor level 2, then you're probably not in the best spot to be playing Clash in the 1st place. Whether it be intentional (you rage quiting or giving up on the game) or unintentional (internet issues or life constantly pulling you away), you probably shouldn't be playing this or else you could ruin it for other players.
_THIS_. If you are somehow afking to the point that your getting demoted then that should raise your teammates concerns to your playing habits.
If anyone is in need of a team member, I'll be willing to play. After all, teamwork makes the dreamwork {{champion:117}} {{sticker:poppy-wink}}

On Discord we have a channel for finding a team if you're looking for extras or need a team yourself. Come on in!
https://discord.gg/league-clash-beta-na
why do we have to be at least honor level 2? I've been stuck at level 1 for about 5 months with no sign of progress and really want to contest.
Probably so we don't get forced to play with or against toxic people. Don't be toxic, and you wouldn't hit lvl. 1 in the first place.

I don't think you understand how easy it is to get demoted in honor level. My friend called someone an "idiot" and that set him down an honor level and now he can't participate in a fun game mode with friends. It's just counterproductive too when the toxic player only flames their team, but if you're not playing with randoms there isn't an issue.
I have no sympathy for your friend. Frankly it's too easy to get honor.
these are the people who bait others into being toxic so they can report them this is the real problem riot tilt baiters and the toxic gameplay

I think what he means is that, even though he's exhibited reformed behaviour in 5 months (allegedly), he hasn't been able to meet the honour requirement. In all honesty, it's true that honour is a very steep climb and it sucks for players to be locked out of this mode for having bad attitude in a game that happened last year.
Dont be toxic, i am almost honor 4.:3

I had over 4k total honors before the system change. One 7game chat restriction because a 4man premade reported me because they didn't like me and now I've been at 0 honor for well over a thousand games and hundred or so onwards honors.
That's probably the only reason. For sure.

yeah honor level 2 is a pain ive been stuck at 0 after my 2 week for 5 months and its getting frustrating. I have not flamed in my past games except give advice like positioning etc. and I really wanted to play with my friends but since im not honor level 2 I can't. :/
As long as you've cleaned things up you should be able to bounce back to Honor level 2 over time. We buffed the climb rate a few patches back.

I've been at honor 1 after about 500 games and 3 months. Stuck at checkpoint 1, literally impossible to get back to honor 2 for this... Really disappointed, i've been following clash since you guys released the beta for EU and have been super pumped but it looks like I cant even play in it now. Depressing af.

Either you're heavily exaggerating or you're really not doing anything to actually get it back up. I've played maybe 200 games total this entire season and I'm one checkpoint away from honor 4 . I can't magically pull up your chat logs, but I'm very sure you are doing something wrong.

I was in this situation due to a ban towards the end of last season, so I think I can understand why some people are frustrated. However, I do not sympathize with those who are actually toxic and say that playing with friends shouldn't involve their behaviours outside of clash mode. However, the comment above isn't all too far from the truth at all. The problem was that going from the status of dishonorable to honor level 1 took an EXTREMELY long time (for me it was about 3-4 months), which led them to patch it in order to make it easier. I do not know how much easier it is now. Other than that, getting from Honor level 1 to 2 should only take a month or so if you play a decent bit and refrain from being toxic. Therefore depending on how much someone plays, someone could have been banned many many months ago for a slip-up and they are now locked from an exciting new game mode. From that perspective, you can kind of understand some the frustration of a very small minority.
i was chat restricted last june and chat restricted at season start and i still havent moved in honor :)

Really disappointed in the start times. 5 PM as the only time for Saturday and Sunday? What about people who work on the weekends? Would have liked at least two times like they have on Friday. Or at least some rewards that aren't exclusive to the beta... so those who can't attend aren't missing out on some special stuff.
